intro: Gymnanthes angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gymnanthes, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces non-toxic, fleshy berries that are edible when ripe. Gymnanthes angustifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
